storyTitle: As Manager, I want to view real-time attendance status on a dashboard to achieve immediate workforce visibility

testCases.title: Validate real-time attendance data display on dashboard
preconditions: Manager has valid login credentials with dashboard access permissions
Attendance database contains current employee attendance records
Network connection is stable
Browser is compatible (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, or Edge latest versions)

steps.action: Navigate to the attendance dashboard login page
steps.expectedResult: Login page is displayed with username and password fields

steps.action: Enter valid manager credentials and click Login button
steps.expectedResult: Manager is authenticated and redirected to the attendance dashboard

steps.action: Observe the dashboard upon initial load
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard loads with current attendance data showing employee presence indicators, summary metrics (total present, absent, late), and timestamp of last update

steps.action: Note the current timestamp displayed on the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Timestamp shows the current date and time of data refresh

steps.action: Wait and observe the dashboard for 30 seconds without any interaction
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard automatically refreshes and updates the timestamp to reflect new data at the 30-second mark

steps.action: Continue observing the dashboard for an additional 30 seconds
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard refreshes again automatically at the next 30-second interval with updated attendance data and timestamp

steps.action: Locate and click on the team filter dropdown menu
steps.expectedResult: Team filter dropdown expands showing list of available teams

steps.action: Select a specific team from the dropdown list
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard updates immediately to display attendance data only for the selected team, with summary metrics recalculated for filtered data

steps.action: Verify the filtered data matches the selected team
steps.expectedResult: All displayed employee records belong to the selected team, and no records from other teams are visible

steps.action: Observe the dashboard for 30 seconds after filtering
steps.expectedResult: Filtered data continues to refresh automatically every 30 seconds maintaining the applied filter

postconditions: Manager remains logged into the dashboard
Team filter remains applied
Dashboard continues auto-refresh cycle
No errors or warnings are displayed

testCases.title: Verify drill-down to individual employee attendance details
preconditions: Manager is logged into the attendance dashboard
Dashboard is displaying current attendance data with multiple employee records
At least one employee presence indicator is visible on the dashboard
Employee detail view functionality is enabled

steps.action: Identify an employee presence indicator on the dashboard (e.g., employee name or status icon)
steps.expectedResult: Employee presence indicators are clearly visible and clickable on the dashboard

steps.action: Click on a specific employee presence indicator
steps.expectedResult: Detailed attendance view opens displaying comprehensive information for the selected employee

steps.action: Review the detailed attendance information displayed
steps.expectedResult: Detail view shows employee name, current status (present/absent/late), check-in time, check-out time (if applicable), location, and any relevant attendance notes

steps.action: Verify that the detail view is clearly distinguishable from the summary view
steps.expectedResult: Detail view is displayed in a modal, overlay, or separate panel with clear visual distinction from the main dashboard

steps.action: Locate the close button or back navigation option in the detail view
steps.expectedResult: Close button (X icon) or back button is visible and accessible in the detail view

steps.action: Click the close button to exit the detail view
steps.expectedResult: Detail view closes and dashboard returns to the summary view showing all employee attendance data

steps.action: Verify the summary view is restored correctly
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard displays the same summary view as before drill-down, with all filters and settings preserved

postconditions: Dashboard is in summary view mode
No detail views are open
All previous filter settings remain intact
Dashboard continues normal auto-refresh functionality

testCases.title: Test dashboard load performance
preconditions: Manager has valid login credentials
Standard network connection is available (minimum 10 Mbps)
Browser cache is cleared to simulate realistic load conditions
Attendance database contains representative data volume
Performance measurement tool or browser developer tools are available

steps.action: Open browser developer tools and navigate to the Network tab
steps.expectedResult: Developer tools are open with Network tab active and ready to record

steps.action: Clear browser cache and cookies
steps.expectedResult: Cache and cookies are cleared successfully

steps.action: Start network recording in developer tools
steps.expectedResult: Network activity recording is active

steps.action: Navigate to the attendance dashboard login page
steps.expectedResult: Login page loads successfully

steps.action: Enter valid manager credentials and click Login button, simultaneously start timer
steps.expectedResult: Authentication process begins

steps.action: Observe the dashboard loading process until fully rendered
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard completes loading with all attendance data, summary metrics, and UI elements fully visible and interactive

steps.action: Stop timer when dashboard is fully loaded and check the elapsed time
steps.expectedResult: Total load time from login submission to fully rendered dashboard is 3 seconds or less

steps.action: Review network tab in developer tools to verify API response times
steps.expectedResult: API endpoint /api/dashboard/attendance responds within acceptable time contributing to overall 3-second load target

steps.action: Verify all dashboard elements are functional immediately after load
steps.expectedResult: All buttons, filters, and interactive elements are responsive and functional without delay

postconditions: Dashboard is fully loaded and operational
Manager is logged in and viewing attendance data
Performance metrics are recorded and meet the 3-second requirement
All dashboard features are accessible

storyTitle: As Manager, I want to filter attendance data by team and location to achieve focused workforce insights

testCases.title: Validate filtering by team
preconditions: Manager is logged into the attendance dashboard
Dashboard is displaying attendance data for multiple teams
Team filter dropdown is visible and accessible
Attendance database contains records for at least 2 different teams
No filters are currently applied

steps.action: Observe the initial dashboard state and note the total number of employees displayed
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard shows attendance data for all teams with total employee count visible in summary metrics

steps.action: Locate the team filter dropdown on the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Team filter dropdown is visible with a label such as 'Filter by Team' or 'Team'

steps.action: Click on the team filter dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Dropdown expands showing a list of all available teams with team names clearly displayed

steps.action: Select a specific team from the dropdown list (e.g., 'Engineering Team')
steps.expectedResult: Selected team is highlighted and dropdown closes automatically

steps.action: Observe the dashboard update after team selection
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard refreshes and displays attendance data only for the selected team within 2 seconds

steps.action: Verify that all displayed employee records belong to the selected team
steps.expectedResult: All visible employee records show team affiliation matching the selected team, and no employees from other teams are displayed

steps.action: Check the summary metrics (total present, absent, late)
steps.expectedResult: Summary metrics are recalculated and display counts only for the filtered team

steps.action: Verify the team filter indicator shows the active filter
steps.expectedResult: Team filter dropdown or a filter tag displays the currently selected team name

steps.action: Locate and click the clear filter button or option (e.g., 'Clear', 'X' icon, or 'All Teams' option)
steps.expectedResult: Clear filter option is clicked successfully

steps.action: Observe the dashboard after clearing the team filter
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard updates to show attendance data for all teams, returning to the initial unfiltered state with all employee records visible

steps.action: Verify the employee count matches the original total before filtering
steps.expectedResult: Total employee count in summary metrics matches the count observed in step 1

postconditions: Team filter is cleared and set to show all teams
Dashboard displays complete attendance data for all teams
No filters are active
Dashboard continues auto-refresh functionality

testCases.title: Validate combined filtering by team and location
preconditions: Manager is logged into the attendance dashboard
Dashboard is displaying attendance data for multiple teams and locations
Both team and location filter dropdowns are visible and accessible
Attendance database contains records with various team and location combinations
At least one employee exists matching a specific team-location combination
No filters are currently applied

steps.action: Observe the initial dashboard state and note the total number of employees displayed
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard shows attendance data for all teams and locations with complete employee count in summary metrics

steps.action: Click on the team filter dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Team filter dropdown expands showing list of available teams

steps.action: Select a specific team from the dropdown (e.g., 'Sales Team')
steps.expectedResult: Selected team is applied and dashboard updates to show only employees from the Sales Team

steps.action: Note the number of employees displayed after team filter is applied
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard shows reduced employee count reflecting only the selected team members

steps.action: Click on the location filter dropdown while team filter is active
steps.expectedResult: Location filter dropdown expands showing list of available locations

steps.action: Select a specific location from the dropdown (e.g., 'London Office')
steps.expectedResult: Selected location is applied and dropdown closes

steps.action: Observe the dashboard update after applying both filters
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard refreshes within 2 seconds and displays attendance data only for employees matching both the selected team AND selected location

steps.action: Verify each displayed employee record matches both filter criteria
steps.expectedResult: All visible employees belong to 'Sales Team' AND are located in 'London Office', with no records violating either filter condition

steps.action: Check the summary metrics with combined filters applied
steps.expectedResult: Summary metrics (total present, absent, late) reflect only the employees matching both filter criteria

steps.action: Verify both filter indicators show active filters
steps.expectedResult: Both team and location filter displays show the currently selected values ('Sales Team' and 'London Office')

steps.action: Locate and click the clear all filters button or clear each filter individually
steps.expectedResult: Clear filters option is activated successfully

steps.action: Observe the dashboard after clearing all filters
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard updates to show attendance data for all teams and all locations, returning to the initial unfiltered state

steps.action: Verify the employee count matches the original total before any filtering
steps.expectedResult: Total employee count in summary metrics matches the count observed in step 1, confirming all data is visible again

postconditions: All filters are cleared
Dashboard displays complete attendance data for all teams and locations
No active filters are shown
Dashboard maintains normal functionality and auto-refresh

storyTitle: As Manager, I want to view attendance trend graphs to achieve insights into workforce attendance patterns

testCases.title: Validate attendance trend graph display
preconditions: Manager is logged into the system with valid credentials
Manager has role-based access to attendance dashboard
Historical attendance data exists in the system for the selected date range
Network connection is stable
Browser is compatible with the dashboard application

steps.action: Navigate to the attendance dashboard from the main menu
steps.expectedResult: Attendance dashboard page loads successfully and displays the trend visualization section

steps.action: Locate the date range selector in the trend visualization section
steps.expectedResult: Date range selector is visible with start date and end date fields

steps.action: Select a start date from the date picker (e.g., first day of current month)
steps.expectedResult: Start date is populated in the date range selector field

steps.action: Select an end date from the date picker (e.g., last day of current month)
steps.expectedResult: End date is populated in the date range selector field

steps.action: Click the 'Apply' or 'Update' button to apply the selected date range
steps.expectedResult: Trend graphs update dynamically to display attendance data for the selected date range with line and bar charts visible

steps.action: Verify that absenteeism rates trend graph is displayed on the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Absenteeism rates graph is visible showing data points for the selected date range with appropriate labels and legends

steps.action: Verify that late arrival trends graph is displayed on the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Late arrival trends graph is visible showing data points for the selected date range with appropriate labels and legends

steps.action: Cross-verify the displayed attendance metrics with source data records
steps.expectedResult: Graphs accurately reflect attendance metrics with 95% or higher accuracy compared to source data

postconditions: Attendance trend graphs are displayed for the selected date range
Dashboard remains in active state for further interactions
Selected date range is retained in the session

testCases.title: Validate graph export functionality
preconditions: Manager is logged into the system with valid credentials

steps.action: Locate the export button on the trend graph section (typically represented by a download icon or 'Export' button)

steps.action: Return to the dashboard and click the export button again
steps.expectedResult: Export options menu appears again

steps.action: Select 'Export as PDF' option from the menu
steps.expectedResult: Graph is downloaded as a PDF file to the default download location

steps.action: Navigate to the download location and open the downloaded PDF file
steps.expectedResult: PDF file opens successfully and displays the trend graph with all data points, labels, and legends clearly visible in proper formatting

postconditions: Trend graph files (image and PDF) are successfully downloaded to local machine
Dashboard remains active and functional
Downloaded files are accessible and readable

storyTitle: As Manager, I want to customize dashboard views to achieve personalized attendance monitoring

testCases.title: Test configuration of data refresh intervals
preconditions: Manager is logged into the system with valid credentials
Dashboard is loaded and displaying attendance data
Dashboard customization or settings menu is accessible
System supports configurable data refresh intervals
Real-time or near real-time data updates are available

steps.action: Navigate to dashboard settings or customization options
steps.expectedResult: Settings menu or customization panel is displayed

steps.action: Locate the 'Data Refresh Interval' or 'Auto-Refresh' configuration option
steps.expectedResult: Data refresh interval setting is visible with current value displayed (e.g., default 30 seconds or manual)

steps.action: Click on the data refresh interval dropdown or input field
steps.expectedResult: Available refresh interval options are displayed (e.g., 30 seconds, 60 seconds, 2 minutes, 5 minutes, manual)

steps.action: Select '60 seconds' from the available refresh interval options
steps.expectedResult: 60 seconds option is selected and highlighted in the configuration

steps.action: Click 'Save' or 'Apply' button to confirm the refresh interval setting
steps.expectedResult: Confirmation message appears indicating 'Refresh interval updated successfully' and settings are saved

steps.action: Exit the settings menu and return to the main dashboard view
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard is displayed with active widgets showing current attendance data

steps.action: Note the current timestamp and data values displayed on the dashboard widgets
steps.expectedResult: Current data values and timestamp are documented for comparison

steps.action: Wait for 60 seconds without interacting with the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Time elapses with no manual interaction

steps.action: Observe the dashboard after 60 seconds have elapsed
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard automatically refreshes and updates data without manual intervention

steps.action: Verify that the timestamp or data values have been updated
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard displays updated data with new timestamp indicating automatic refresh occurred at the 60-second interval

steps.action: Continue observing for another 60-second interval
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard refreshes again after another 60 seconds, confirming consistent refresh behavior

steps.action: Check browser network activity or console for refresh API calls
steps.expectedResult: Network logs show periodic API calls to refresh data occurring every 60 seconds

postconditions: Data refresh interval is set to 60 seconds
Dashboard automatically refreshes data every 60 seconds

Dashboard continues to function normally with automatic refresh enabled
